page.title: 14ARTS AND CRAFTS IN WELSHPOOL
page.content: The largest displays of Arts and Crafts are displayed at the Oriel 31 art gallery which was opened in 1982. Displays here are shown once a month and include those by famous artists eg. Jonathan Kingdom, local artists and school children. The stock of original prints held in the Oriel is the largest in Wales. The Gallery runs life drawing classes, poetry readings, children's art classes, drawing classes and organises visits to galleries and museums. Exhibitions are also held at the Library. At present there is a display of work done by junior school pupils commemorating the 500th anniversary of the Battle Of Bosworth with drawings of life at the time and showing Henry Tudor's route to the battle via Welshpool.
